name: SSF3
title: CS Site-Specific Factor 3
subtitle: Ulceration and Edema
notes:
**Note 1**:  Tumor associated edema or ulceration is considered a poor risk.

**Note 2**:  Tumor associated edema or ulceration is usually histologically confirmed and documented in the pathology report.  If tumor associated edema or ulceration is diagnosed clinically without pathologic confirmation, use code 040.

**Note 3**:  If there is no documentation or no mention of ulceration or edema in the pathology report or clinical examination, assume ulceration and edema are not present and use code 000.
rows: Clinical diagnosis of edema and/or ulceration

OBSOLETE DATA CONVERTED V0200

See code 988: Not applicable for this schema

Not applicable:  Information not collected for this case
(May include cases converted from code 888 used in CSv1 for "Not applicable" or when the item was not collected.  If this item is required to derive T, N, M, or any stage, use of code 988 may result in an error.)

Unknown or no information
Not documented in patient record
